results.title: A Sad realisation
results.creator_credit: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.
description_for_label: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.

results.title: iFavourite
results.creator_credit: Peter Ngo, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A glimpse into Peter Ngo’s world of techno music, video games, video editing and fun in the sun at the Alpine School. To Ngo’s mind, doing what you enjoy is the path to happiness and finding yourself.

results.title: Second reality
results.creator_credit: Stacey Fischer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Always on the move, changing schools, losing new friends, Stacey Fischer escaped from the real world of loneliness to a world where she could create people who couldn’t leave - a place where she would be safe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stacey Fischer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Always on the move, changing schools, losing new friends, Stacey Fischer escaped from the real world of loneliness to a world where she could create people who couldn’t leave - a place where she would be safe.

results.title: My first year
results.creator_credit: Louise Bryant, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Louise shares her experiences and the three most important lessons she learnt in her first year as a secondary teacher. These are the things they don’t teach you at uni; survival, rewards and pleasant surprises.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Bryant, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Little something about us
results.creator_credit: School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne and Sze Ching Lee
results.brief_description: Interviews with several young women from diverse Asian backgrounds who, through pixellated images, share their aspirations, interests, and love-hate relationships with Mellbourne, the city that has adopted them.

results.title: Where my heart lies
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vicki Baker and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vicki Baker and ACMI
results.description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.

results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Richard Bailey and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.
